id: The SAT Isn’t About Intelligence… Here’s How to Win
group_title: S2E282: The SAT Isn’t About Intelligence… Here’s How to Win (Part 1)

generated_content.high_level_summary: This two-part podcast series, hosted by Mackenzie Price and Alpha student Elle, fundamentally redefines the SAT, arguing it's not an IQ test but a measure of effort, strategy, and foundational knowledge. It champions Alpha's philosophy that any student can achieve top scores (e.g., 1350+ or even 1500+) through a growth mindset and specific, accessible preparation methods. The episodes delve into practical strategies, such as mastering 'fast math' (basic arithmetic fluency) for the math section and memorizing grammar rules for the English section, which are crucial for freeing up cognitive load and managing time effectively. Listeners will discover how to leverage free and affordable online resources like YouTube, Asely, IXL, and the College Board's official question bank, along with strategic use of the Desmos graphing calculator on the digital SAT. A significant focus is placed on the 'mental game' of test-taking, advocating for multiple attempts to reduce anxiety and emphasizing the importance of understanding underlying concepts over rote memorization. The hosts also highlight the SAT's increasing relevance as colleges reinstate requirements due to its correlation with college success, making a strategic and empowered approach more vital than ever.
key_takeaways: The SAT is not an IQ test; it's a test of effort, strategy, and foundational knowledge, making it highly improvable for any student.
Mastering 'fast math' (basic arithmetic fluency) is crucial for the math section, as it frees up working memory and time for complex problems.
Memorizing grammar rules is the 'fast math' equivalent for the English section, enabling quicker and more accurate responses.

Utilize accessible online resources like YouTube tutorials, AI-generated practice questions (Asely), foundational skill drills (IXL), and the College Board's official question bank to understand concepts and identify trends.
Develop a strong mental game: approach the test with a growth mindset, take it multiple times to reduce anxiety, and trust your preparation.
Strategically use the Desmos graphing calculator on the digital SAT for complex problems, but ensure core math knowledge is solid.
For reading comprehension, read widely in various genres (e.g., scientific papers, poetry) to build familiarity with jargon and passage structures.
Focus on understanding underlying concepts rather than just memorizing how to solve specific problem types.
Colleges are increasingly reinstating SAT requirements, as scores correlate with student success in higher education.
generated_content.why_listen: Listen to these episodes to demystify the SAT and gain a refreshing, empowering perspective on test preparation. If you're a student feeling overwhelmed or a parent seeking effective, accessible strategies, this series offers practical, actionable advice that goes beyond traditional tutoring. It debunks the myth that SAT scores are fixed by intelligence, providing a roadmap for significant score improvement through focused effort, strategic learning, and a positive mindset. You'll learn specific techniques for both math and English, discover valuable (often free) resources, and understand how to approach the test's psychological challenges, ultimately transforming the SAT from a dreaded hurdle into an achievable goal.
topics: English language arts (grammar rules, reading comprehension)
Learning science principles (working memory, cognitive load)
Online educational resources (YouTube, Asely, IXL, College Board)

episodes.filename: S2E282 The SAT Isn’t About Intelligence… Here’s How to Win (Part 1).json
episodes.title: S2E282: The SAT Isn’t About Intelligence… Here’s How to Win (Part 1)
episodes.publisher_summary: We’re diving into one of the most misunderstood parts of college admissions: the SAT. MacKenzie is joined by student cohost Elle, an Alpha veteran who recently scored a 790 in math. Elle breaks down Alpha’s approach to the SAT and explains why the test isn’t an intelligence measure but a reflection of how well students can study, prepare, and perform under pressure. We talk through why and how Alpha believes any student can score in the top 10% with the right preparation. If you’ve ever wondered whether the SAT is beatable, Elle’s going to change your mind.

episodes.filename: S2E283 The Truth About the SAT Mindset Matters More Than IQ (Part 2).json
episodes.title: S2E283: The Truth About the SAT: Mindset Matters More Than IQ (Part 2)
episodes.publisher_summary: In Part 2 of this SAT strategy series, MacKenzie and Alpha student cohost Elle return to break down Alpha's approach to the SAT, particularly the importance of mindset. Elle, who recently scored a 790 in math, shares the mindset framework she used to drastically increase her score over time, emphasizing how the test isn’t an intelligence measure but instead a reflection of preparation. No matter what tests your kids or students have coming up, this mindset work is an invaluable tool in their toolkit for success.
